com.github.lorciv.flag

Class FlagSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.lorciv.flag.FlagSet

  • public class FlagSet
extends java.lang.Object

    A FlagSet represents a set of defined flags. Flags can be defined using add methods, and then parsed with parse. After parsing, the remaining non-flag arguments can be accessed with args.

    Add methods allow to specify the name, description and default value for the flag. Each add method returns an object that can be used to access the parsed flag value (or the default value) once the FlagSet to which it belongs has been parsed. If multiple flags with the same name are added to a FlagSet, only the last one will be considered.

    Author:
    lorciv

      • addValue

        public void addValue(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String description,
                     FlagValue value)
        Add a new flag to the flag set. The FlagValue object should be set to the default value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the flag
        description - the description of the flag (for usage message)
        value - the object where the flag value will be stored

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String[] args)
           throws FlagException
        Parse the flags from the argument array. It must be called after all flags in the FlagSet are defined and before flag values are accessed by the program.
        Parameters:
        args - the argument array
        Throws:
        FlagException - in case of errors during parsing
